column2: IOWA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

column2: 2. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column6: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 3. Which of the following statements about safe following distance is true?
column4: If weather or road conditions are not ideal, drivers should use three seconds or more to be safe.
column6: The safest way to judge a safe following distance is to use the “Two-Second Rule”.
column8: When the road is slippery, you should allow for more distance between your car and the vehicle in front of you.

column2: 4. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
5. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column10: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
7. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column4: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 8. Alcohol causes:
9. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
10. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
11. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 12. Aggressive driving behaviors can include:
13. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column8: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 14. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
15. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.
column10: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.

column2: 16. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.

column2: 17. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Only if the light is green.
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column10: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.

column2: 18. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
19. This road sign means:
column6: Do not pass on the left.

column2: 20. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column10: drive as they would on dry roads.

column2: 21. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.
column6: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column8: about halfway through the deceleration lane.

column2: 22. Your BAC depends on:
column6: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 23. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column10: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 24. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 25. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
26. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
27. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
28. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column6: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column8: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.

column2: 29. When you see a "merging traffic" sign on the freeway, you should:
column4: slow down to allow traffic to enter.
column6: move to another lane to let traffic enter, if safe.
column10: speed up to avoid congesting traffic.

column2: 30. Which shape is a stop sign?
31. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 32. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 33. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: they already are within the intersection.
column8: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 34. As your speed increases it is most important to:
column4: drive with both hands on steering wheel.

column2: 35. Before backing up, you should:
column4: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
